meanings.definition: A device for raising or hauling objects using a rope or chain wound around a horizontal cylinder.
meanings.sent1: The sailors used windlasses to lift heavy cargo onto the ship.
meanings.sent2: The workers relied on windlasses to hoist the crates onto the truck.
meanings.sent3: The windlasses seemed to have a mind of their own, spinning effortlessly as if eager to help.
meanings.sent4: The old windlasses creaked and groaned like tired giants as they lifted the load.
meanings.sent5: The shiny windlasses gleamed in the sunlight, a testament to their strength and utility.

meanings.definition: To raise or haul something using a windlass.
meanings.sent1: They had to windlasses the heavy boxes up to the attic using a pulley system.
meanings.sent2: He windlasses the fishing net out of the water with practiced ease.
meanings.sent3: She windlasses the bucket up from the well, her muscles straining with effort.
meanings.sent4: The crane operator skillfully windlasses the steel beams into place high above the construction site.
meanings.sent5: As the storm approached, they hurriedly windlasses the boat onto dry land to keep it safe.
